Meet the storage industry’s best marketing agency: McClenahan Bruer.

A history of helping storage vendors reach their goals.

Over our 23-year history, McBru has developed a depth and breadth of expertise in the storage and network services industry that’s hard to match. During that time, we’ve worked with a number of leading storage, cloud and network services companies: start-ups and market leaders, hardware-centric and software-only, on-premises and hybrid-cloud, to tell their story, build their brand and fill their funnel.

Below is a sampling of current and past clients who have chosen McBru’s Brand Development, Brand Narrative and/or Brand Demand services to boost awareness, drive revenue and establish a uniquely strong market position in these markets:

Leading a hybrid cloud startup into the mainstream

Cloudian chose McBru in 2014 as the then-startup emerged from stealth with Series C funding. Since then, McBru has led an aggressive Brand Narrative program to drive media coverage, analyst relationships and industry recognition of Cloudian’s powerful, highly differentiated platform for S3-native private and hybrid cloud deployments.

  • 20 major feature stories in first three months of engagement
  • 524% increase in Twitter followers over six month campaign
  • 40 key influencer briefings in first half of 2016
Work samples go here.

Backup veteran boosts content pipeline, channel preference with Brand Narrative strategies

The 30-year of cloud backup veteran selected McBru to begin 2016 with a comprehensive Brand Narrative program, strategically integrating news and media relations with robust content marketing. The program continues to advance Asigra’s brand awareness and support its channel-centric sales force with high-value marketing assets and increased affinity for Asigra’s innovative, trustworthy brand and solutions.

  • More than 40 high-value content assets delivered January through September
  • High-impact coverage in all sought-after channel media, with more than 40 features and mentions
  • More than 90 social posts delivered year-to-date

Parallel storage pioneers go commercial with well targeted media relations and social presence

Panasas chose McBru in 2011 as the company began to evolve from its origins in l¬¬¬¬arge-scale HPC workloads and apply its unique approach to parallel file systems to broader commercial markets. McBru led Brand Narrative efforts for the company through 2016, with an emphasis on targeted press and analyst relations integrated with social media community management to tell the company’s story to technical and non-technical audiences.

  • Diversified media reach – 50 stories in industry vertical outlets in one calendar year
  • Extended beyond direct following to generate more than 1.1 million annual social media impressions
  • More than 250% increase in LinkedIn company following
Work samples go here.

From tough times to historical exit with McBru’s communications programs at the fore

Isilon selected McBru in January 2009 as the company began to emerge from a securities investigation that saw restated earnings and the departure of key executives. With its business now in order, Isilon was ready to relaunch. McBru supplied the missing ingredients with a launch strategy and all-new positioning and messaging framework that put Isilon back in front of the market with a consistently positive, forward-looking story of innovation and scale-out storage category leadership. McBru’s integrated media relations and social media marketing did the heavy lifting for Isilon’s outbound marketing as the company’s share price climbed from under $2 to a buyout by EMC Corp. for more than $33/share.

  • Year-over-year increase in aided awareness of 64%
  • Year-over-year increase in purchase consideration of 150%
  • More than 60 feature story placements in a calendar year
  • McBru-built messaging platform guided communications from relaunch through acquisition
Work samples go here.

Driving sales pipeline from start-up to industry leader

McBru supported scale-out storage start-up PolyServe with integrated Brand Demand and Brand Narrative marketing programs beginning in 2005, leading a highly aggressive media and analyst relations program that earned outsized coverage for the up-and-coming software vendor while designing and executing a demand generation and lead nurturing program that produced more than 10,000 net new MQLs in a single year, driving substantial revenue.

In 2007, HP bought PolyServe to integrate its file system technology into its StorageWorks division. Recognizing the value of McBru’s strategic programs, HP continued forward with McBru for another two years with an ongoing engagement focused on content marketing, demand generation and lead nurturing programs.

  • More than 10,000 net new marketing qualified leads in one year
  • Strategy and execution for comprehensive lead nurturing program to segmented marketing database of more than 60,000 contacts
  • A 122% lift in aided brand awareness and 55% lift in purchase intent over the course of a single brand advertising campaign
Work samples go here.

Holistic communications support for brand in transition

Network services provider Integra engaged McBru at an inflection point in the brand’s storied history. One of the few regional CLECs born of the 1996 Telecommunications Act to survive and thrive through the dot-com era, Integra had built its business on services and support tailored to SMBs. With that market under threat by lower-cost cable providers, Integra sought to leverage its considerable fiberoptic assets to support an organizational shift toward enterprise customers as its core focus.

Integra chose McBru and its brand development and brand narrative programs to set the strategy for a new brand identity that reflected the company’s evolution and its new, sophisticated marketplace and audiences. With a blend of PR, social media and content strategy, McBru executed the vast communications effort to deliver the messages behind the company’s new brand to the audiences that needed to hear it, successfully positioning the company squarely in front of the enterprise buyers and influencers who were looking for a nimble, asset-rich alternative to pricey, inflexible incumbent carriers.

  • Led strategy and execution for relaunch of corporate brand, earning extensive coverage and cementing perception of brand as enterprise-focused
  • More than 100 Integra-focused feature stories in one calendar year
  • Managed reputation and crisis PR; led negative coverage of service issues to new lows
  • Devised corporate blog editorial strategy and launch; drove readership past 1,000 per post in first three months
Work samples go here.

We believe storage vendors are a perfect fit for McBru’s extensive industry experience and exclusive focus on B2B technology clients and markets:

To survive and thrive in tightly competitive markets, storage vendors require creative marketing solutions and rock-solid program execution so they can get the maximum result from every marketing dollar invested and “punch above their weight” regardless of size.

To stay current in the eyes of a fast-moving, forward-looking audience, storage vendors need a strategic partner that keeps their messaging fresh, their story aligned with industry trends and their content connected with the ever-changing market.

To earn and maintain credibility with overworked admins, put-upon IT managers and skeptical executives, storage vendors need an IT-savvy, storage-centric agency team that stays on top of the brands, technologies and influencers who drive the storage market.

Want to learn more about McBru and our Brand Narrative, Brand Demand and Brand Development marketing programs for storage vendors? Please get in touch.
